issue.title: How to query if robot is initialized

content.raw:
> You ignore the issue of knowing whether the final checkpoint in a task has completed when doing the competition task by task.

I agree this is an issue, we ran into the same thing when implementing scoring, I'll take a look.

> Also, still ignoring the restart situation where knowing the current task is difficult.

* The restart service which will be provided restarts the current checkpoint. 
* It isn't possible to go back to a previous checkpoint
* When skipping to a checkpoint ahead, teams need to name which checkpoint they want. 
* While restarting/skipping, the usual task message will still be published, and time will still be counting down.

I'm currently implementing a new publisher which will publish harness status so teams know when Val has been lowered and is ready to be controlled.
content.html:
You ignore the issue of knowing whether the final checkpoint in a task has completed when doing the competition task by task.

I agree this is an issue, we ran into the same thing when implementing scoring, I'll take a look.

Also, still ignoring the restart situation where knowing the current task is difficult.

  • The restart service which will be provided restarts the current checkpoint.
  • It isn't possible to go back to a previous checkpoint
  • When skipping to a checkpoint ahead, teams need to name which checkpoint they want.
  • While restarting/skipping, the usual task message will still be published, and time will still be counting down.

I'm currently implementing a new publisher which will publish harness status so teams know when Val has been lowered and is ready to be controlled.
